alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 7:15AM ChST until August 31 at 9:15AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tiyan Guam has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Guam * Until 915 AM ChST. * At 712 AM ChST, Doppler radar and rain gages indicated heavy rain falling along and south of Cross Island Road, mainly south of a line from Piti to Yona . Rain was falling at a rate of 0.5 inches per hour. However, these areas have already received 1.5 to 2.25 inches of rainfall, with additional heavy rain moving into the area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and rain gages. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chalan Pago-Ordot, Yona, Talofofo, Inarajan, Asan, Merizo, Piti, Santa Rita and Umatac. This warning may need to be extended beyond 915 AM ChST if heavy rain persists. #replacePrevBulletFFW(${areas}) FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAGE INDICATED
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring within the warned area. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of drainage ditches and streams, streets, highways, properties, and other low lying spots.
